channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: The world's largest iceberg is stuck twirling in an ocean vortex
item.description: Iceberg A23a — equivalent to the size of Rhode Island — has been near the South Orkney Islands since January, completing one full rotation every 24 days or so.
item.content:encoded:
Iceberg A23a — equivalent to the size of Rhode Island — has been near the South Orkney Islands since January, completing one full rotation every 24 days or so.

(Image credit: /)
item.dc:creator: Juliana Kim

item.title: Thomas Bach who led the Olympic Games in sport and controversy will leave after 2025
item.description: Thomas Bach's tenure as Olympics leader has been controversial as took the IOC through doping scandals, controversy involving Chinese and Russian influence, and two Games held during Covid pandemic.
item.content:encoded:
Thomas Bach's tenure as Olympics leader has been controversial as took the IOC through doping scandals, controversy involving Chinese and Russian influence, and two Games held during Covid pandemic.

(Image credit: Indranil Mukherjee)
item.dc:creator: Brian Mann

item.title: Endangered red wolf population on the rebound with captive breeding program
item.description: Efforts to bring back the critically endangered red wolves are showing optimistic signs of some success.
item.content:encoded: Efforts to bring back the critically endangered red wolves are showing optimistic signs of some success.
item.dc:creator: Elizabeth Friend

item.title: What does the future of hostage diplomacy look like?
item.description: The recent hostage swap with the Kremlin raises questions about the risks of future detentions.
item.content:encoded: The recent hostage swap with the Kremlin raises questions about the risks of future detentions.
item.dc:creator: Jackie Northam

item.title: California Governor threatens funding cuts for counties that don't remove homeless encampments
item.description: California Governor Gavin Newsom has threatened local county governments with funding cuts if they don't do enough to get people off the street. He recently passed an executive order encouraging local governments to remove homeless encampments.
item.content:encoded: California Governor Gavin Newsom has threatened local county governments with funding cuts if they don't do enough to get people off the street. He recently passed an executive order encouraging local governments to remove homeless encampments.
item.dc:creator: Anna Scott

item.title: 'Tested' investigates long history of sports sex testing
item.description: NPR’s Embedded podcast has a new series about sex testing in elite sports with CBC in Canada. It's called Tested.
item.content:encoded: NPR’s Embedded podcast has a new series about sex testing in elite sports with CBC in Canada. It's called Tested.
item.dc:creator: Mallory Yu

item.title: The role of Islamic State affiliated groups on foiled attacks in Vienna
item.description: NPR's Pien Huang speaks to Ashley Jackson, co-director of the Center on Armed Groups, about the role of Islamic State affiliate groups on the recent foiled attacks on a Taylor Swift concert in Vienna.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Pien Huang speaks to Ashley Jackson, co-director of the Center on Armed Groups, about the role of Islamic State affiliate groups on the recent foiled attacks on a Taylor Swift concert in Vienna.
item.dc:creator: Pien Huang

item.title: The U.S. men's basketball team topples France to win its fifth straight Olympic gold
item.description: The Americans' streak of dominance in Olympic men's basketball has only grown more impressive as international basketball has become more competitive than ever. The U.S. defeated host France 98-87.
item.content:encoded:
The Americans' streak of dominance in Olympic men's basketball has only grown more impressive as international basketball has become more competitive than ever. The U.S. defeated host France 98-87.

(Image credit: Aris Messinis)
item.dc:creator: Becky Sullivan

item.title: U.S. women, men seize a pair of golds in Olympic 4-by-400m relays
item.description: U.S. women cruised to victory in the 4 by 400 relay in Saint-Denis, France. American men, meanwhile, prevailed in a hard-fought relay at the same distance, beating Botswana.
item.content:encoded:
U.S. women cruised to victory in the 4 by 400 relay in Saint-Denis, France. American men, meanwhile, prevailed in a hard-fought relay at the same distance, beating Botswana.

(Image credit: Patrick Smith)
item.dc:creator: Brian Mann

item.title: American Masai Russell wins Olympic gold in 100m hurdles by a 100th of a second
item.description: In a photo finish, Masai Russell of the U.S. captured a gold medal in the hundred-meter hurdle sprint, beating a French runner by 0.01 seconds.
item.content:encoded:
In a photo finish, Masai Russell of the U.S. captured a gold medal in the hundred-meter hurdle sprint, beating a French runner by 0.01 seconds.

(Image credit: Petr David Josek)
item.dc:creator: Brian Mann
